title: Possible compiler error.
body:
Please pardon me if that's not a true error, but everything here point to something being wrong.

I tried to compile project:

I have `rustc 1.9.0-dev (998a6720b 2016-03-07)`

```
$ git clone https://github.com/hfiguiere/foxbox.git
$ cd foxbox ; git checkout rustc-scope
$ cargo test
```

I get a compiler error.

```
   Compiling foxbox v0.1.0 (file:///home/hub/source/mozilla/foxbox)
src/service_router.rs:161:34: 161:51 error: no method named `get_users_manager` found for type `controller::FoxBox` in the current scope
src/service_router.rs:161         let manager = controller.get_users_manager();
                                                           ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/service_router.rs:149:1: 255:2 note: in this expansion of describe! (defined in src/main.rs)
src/service_router.rs:161:34: 161:51 help: items from traits can only be used if the trait is in scope; the following trait is implemented but not in scope, perhaps add a `use` for it:
src/service_router.rs:161:34: 161:51 help: candidate #1: `use controller::Controller`
src/service_router.rs:163:30: 163:56 error: the type of this value must be known in this context
src/service_router.rs:163             .mount("/users", manager.get_router_chain());
                                                       ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/service_router.rs:149:1: 255:2 note: in this expansion of describe! (defined in src/main.rs)
src/service_router.rs:175:13: 175:23 error: the type of this value must be known in this context
src/service_router.rs:175             db.clear().ok();
                                      ^~~~~~~~~~
src/service_router.rs:149:1: 255:2 note: in this expansion of describe! (defined in src/main.rs)
src/service_router.rs:161:34: 161:51 error: no method named `get_users_manager` found for type `controller::FoxBox` in the current scope
src/service_router.rs:161         let manager = controller.get_users_manager();
                                                           ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/service_router.rs:149:1: 255:2 note: in this expansion of describe! (defined in src/main.rs)
src/service_router.rs:161:34: 161:51 help: items from traits can only be used if the trait is in scope; the following trait is implemented but not in scope, perhaps add a `use` for it:
src/service_router.rs:161:34: 161:51 help: candidate #1: `use controller::Controller`
src/service_router.rs:163:30: 163:56 error: the type of this value must be known in this context
src/service_router.rs:163             .mount("/users", manager.get_router_chain());
                                                       ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/service_router.rs:149:1: 255:2 note: in this expansion of describe! (defined in src/main.rs)
src/service_router.rs:175:13: 175:23 error: the type of this value must be known in this context
src/service_router.rs:175             db.clear().ok();
                                      ^~~~~~~~~~
src/service_router.rs:149:1: 255:2 note: in this expansion of describe! (defined in src/main.rs)
src/service_router.rs:161:34: 161:51 error: no method named `get_users_manager` found for type `controller::FoxBox` in the current scope
src/service_router.rs:161         let manager = controller.get_users_manager();
                                                           ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/service_router.rs:149:1: 255:2 note: in this expansion of describe! (defined in src/main.rs)
src/service_router.rs:161:34: 161:51 help: items from traits can only be used if the trait is in scope; the following trait is implemented but not in scope, perhaps add a `use` for it:
src/service_router.rs:161:34: 161:51 help: candidate #1: `use controller::Controller`
src/service_router.rs:163:30: 163:56 error: the type of this value must be known in this context
src/service_router.rs:163             .mount("/users", manager.get_router_chain());
                                                       ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/service_router.rs:149:1: 255:2 note: in this expansion of describe! (defined in src/main.rs)
error: aborting due to 8 previous errors
Could not compile `foxbox`.
```

So, classic "I forgot to use the trait", in that case a `use controller::Controller;`. See https://github.com/hfiguiere/foxbox/commit/8b3745e766df9f5be80d67f9633700acf18134a5#diff-2b028424809a6315630f8281a5f7d1e3R160 where it is commented.
Now, if I uncomment that line 160, and run `$cargo test`, then I get this error:

```
   Compiling foxbox v0.1.0 (file:///home/hub/source/mozilla/foxbox)
src/service_router.rs:215:17: 215:39 error: a trait named `Controller` has already been imported in this module [E0252]
src/service_router.rs:215             use controller::Controller;
                                          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/service_router.rs:149:1: 255:2 note: in this expansion of describe! (defined in src/main.rs)
src/service_router.rs:215:17: 215:39 help: run `rustc --explain E0252` to see a detailed explanation
src/service_router.rs:160:13: 160:35 note: previous import of `Controller` here
src/service_router.rs:160         use controller::Controller;
                                      ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/service_router.rs:149:1: 255:2 note: in this expansion of describe! (defined in src/main.rs)
error: aborting due to previous error
Could not compile `foxbox`.
```

That's right. It either tell me "don't know about trait" or "I already know about it".

That's where I think we have a bug.
